lines.text: Fifteen thousand Marks. A thousand for every year I spent in a stinking, slimy dungeon. You bargain poorly, Herr Ulman.
Don't kill me!

Kill my trusted old assistant? Why, no. I'm going to repay you for betraying me; I'm going to give that brain of yours a new home in the skull of the Frankenstein monster. As for you Strauss, I'm going to give you the brain of the wolfman so that all your waking hours will be spent in untold agony awaiting the full of the moon... which will change you into a werewolf.
Now will you give me my chalk?
Master.
Yes?
Now that I have helped you with Strauss and Ullman, will you give Talbot's body to me?
What?
He's big. He's strong.
Talbot's body is the perfect place for the monster's brain that I will add to and subtract from in my experiments.
Master, you made me a promise.
No! You think I'd wreck the work of a lifetime because you're in love with a, a Gypsy girl?
I've killed four men for you!
Do as I say or I'll never help you.
[last lines]
Quicksand!
What's your name?
Lawrence.
Lawrence? Do they call you Larry?
They used to.
Could Frankenstein have made me like other men?
He gave life to a body that he made from parts of other bodies that had died. Yes, Daniel, he could have made you like other men.
Do you doubt me?
It's a doubting world, kind sir!
